result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael Louis Frankini was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Must be full time employed, if not working must search for 3 jobs a week and report to the agent monthly.
May not enter any bars or taverns.
May not possess or consume alcohol.

timeConds.notes:
Hueber granted.
Good time awarded.
Community service granted under 973.09(7m).
Commencing upon the date any license issued to the defendant.  May not operate any vehicle unless its equipped with the IID.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Louis Frankini

Defendant Michael Louis Frankini in court with attorney Lisa Jean Brouillette.  Douglas j Drexler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Count 1 plea of guilty, OWI 3rd.  Count 2 dismissed.  Motion withdrawn.  Plea is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently given.    Constitutional rights read and waived.  Found guilty  10:43 a.m.  Statement by the State.  10:44 a.m.  Statement by Attorney Brouillette.  10:49 a.m. Statement by Defendant.  Court Sentences:  1 year probation, sentence imposed.  160 days jail stayed.  Fine $1,744, 60 days to pay or CO; DL revoked 24 months; AODA and follow through all recommendations; IID 2 years   Commencing upon the date any license issued to the defendant.  May not operate any vehicle unless its equipped with the IID; Must submit DNA sample, costs $200; full time employment, if not working 3 jobs a week and report to the agent monthly; May not possess or consume alcohol; May not enter any bars or taverns; 50 hours of community service; 1st 45 days in jail, start 04-29-2016 at 9:00 a.m., hueber granted, good time awarded, community service granted under 973.09(7m). arg  tln

Each party to brief the issue.  Brief in 30 days from the State, Lisa 10 days after.  tln  Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 11:00 am.
